Pradeep Bojan <pbojan@...> Thu, 20 Mar 2003 11:42:21 +0530
> Is there any tool for automating GUI, designed by eclipse. I
> basically need it for doing regression testing. Junit doesn't
> support eclipse.

I believe I understand your question, but IMHO your vocabulary is
imprecise :-)

Junit _does_ support eclipse, and vv. But that's not your problem.
Also, there are several tools for automating AWT and Swing UIs,
several of which have excellent JUnit integration (like JFCUnit, which
you know). For more info, see

http://www.superlinksoftware.com/cgi-bin/jugwiki.pl?TestingGUIs

However, most folks writing extensions for Eclipse are gonna be
writing SWT UIs, and that's probably your problem. AFAIK, right now,
the only tools that will automate an SWT UI are

* platform-native tools (about which I know little), such as the
  Mercury tools and Rational Robot. Because SWT is a relatively thin
  layer over the native widgets, platform-native tools will work.
  (AFAIK OTI considers this an acceptable state of affairs--I
  disagree.) I dunno about the level of JUnit integration of any of
  these.

* Rational RobotJ will also do SWT, and has the advantage of allowing
  much of the scripting in Java. Unfortunately AFAIK is has no JUnit
  integration at this time.

However, extending some of the open, JUnit-integrated tools to handle
SWT seems like it should not be rocket science. See 

http://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?thread_id=786073&forum_id=204671
http://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?thread_id=790404&forum_id=168263

which resulted from the long thread on this topic on

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/java-gui-testing/messages/
